00013 int main()
00014 {
00015 
00016   StateMachine machine;
00017   machine.initiate();
00018 
00019   // This should be replaced by a map from string to event
00020 
00021   vector<string> transitions;
00022   transitions.push_back( "Configure" );
00023   transitions.push_back( "Enable" );
00024   transitions.push_back( "Stop" );
00025   transitions.push_back( "Halt" );
00026 
00027   for( unsigned int j = 0; j < 3; ++j )
00028     {
00029 
00030       for( unsigned int i = 0; i < 4; ++i )
00031   {
00032 
00033     string t = transitions[i];
00034 
00035     if( j == 1 && i == 2 ) continue;
00036 
00037     std::cout << "### Requesting " << t << " transition." << std::endl;
00038 
00039     if( t == "Configure" )
00040       {
00041         machine.process_event( Configure() );
00042       }
00043     else if( t == "Enable" )
00044       {
00045         machine.process_event( Enable() );
00046       }
00047     else if( t == "Stop" )
00048       {
00049         machine.process_event( Stop() );
00050       }
00051     else if( t == "Halt" )
00052       {
00053         machine.process_event( Halt() );
00054       }
00055 
00056           // Test if we need to send a StopDone event.  In the real
00057           // system this will be done by a thread that waits until
00058           // the queues are empty and then posts this event.
00059 //           if( machine.getCurrentStateName() == "DrainingQueues" )
00060 //           {
00061 //               machine.process_event( StopDone() );
00062 //           }
00063 
00064     // In the current design, the StateMachine object does not
00065     // process I2O messages.
00066 
00067     //    machine.handleI2OEventMessage();
00068 
00069           
00070           Operations const& currentState = machine.getCurrentState();

00073           FragmentStore dummyFragmentStore;
00074           currentState.processI2OFragment(dummyChain, dummyDistributor,
00075                                           dummyFragmentStore);

00078   }
